back_cards.definition_en: A person belonging to a group or organization
back_cards.example_en: She’s a member of the book club.
He’s a key member of the soccer team.

back_cards.definition_en: A participant in a formal association
back_cards.example_en: All members voted at the annual meeting.

back_cards.definition_en: A part of a larger structure
back_cards.example_en: The beam is a structural member of the bridge.
Members get discounts at the gym.

back_cards.definition_en: A group of people living in the same area
back_cards.example_en: The community gathered for the festival.
The online gaming community is very active.

back_cards.definition_en: A sense of belonging or support
back_cards.example_en: She found community in her church group.
The scientific community welcomed the discovery.
The community raised funds for the park.

back_cards.definition_en: At some time in the past
back_cards.example_en: I visited Paris once last summer.
You can borrow my book, but only once.
Once he arrives, we can start the meeting.
She was once a teacher before retiring.
I saw that movie once and loved it.
She’s very social and loves parties.

back_cards.definition_en: Pertaining to society or its organization
back_cards.example_en: The policy addresses social issues like poverty.
The club organizes social events monthly.
Social media helps her stay connected.
Social workers support vulnerable families.
I watched the news on TV last night.
The newspaper published breaking news.
Have you heard the news about her promotion?
The evening news covered the storm.
The test results were good news for her.
The teacher allowed extra time for the test.
This ticket allows entry to the museum.
The budget allows for new equipment.
The rules don’t allow pets in the building.
Her schedule allows her to work from home.

back_cards.definition_en: To achieve victory in a competition
back_cards.example_en: Our team won the championship game.
She won a scholarship for her grades.
He won her over with his kindness.
They won against the odds in the debate.

back_cards.definition_en: To earn a prize or reward
back_cards.example_en: I won a gift card in the raffle.

back_cards.definition_en: The physical structure of a person or animal
back_cards.example_en: Exercise keeps her body healthy.

back_cards.definition_en: A group of people with a shared purpose
back_cards.example_en: The student body elected a new president.
The body of the essay was well-written.
This book adds to the body of research.
The police found a body near the river.
She led the team to the project site.
He leads the marketing department.

back_cards.definition_en: To be ahead in a competition
back_cards.example_en: Our school leads in the science fair.
His speech led to a heated discussion.

back_cards.definition_en: To show the way by example
back_cards.example_en: She leads by demonstrating strong ethics.
He continued working late into the night.
The rain continued all afternoon.
Let’s continue the meeting after lunch.
They continued the lease for another year.

back_cards.definition_en: To persist in a course of action
back_cards.example_en: She continued her studies despite challenges.
I’m unsure whether to call or text.
She asked whether he was coming to the party.
Whether it rains or shines, we’ll go hiking.
They debated whether the plan would work.
He wondered whether to accept the offer.
We have enough food for the party.
She studied enough to pass the exam.
The room is big enough for two people.
I’ve had enough of this noise!
He runs fast enough to join the team.

back_cards.definition_en: To use money to buy something
back_cards.example_en: She spent $50 on new shoes.

back_cards.definition_en: To pass time in a particular way
back_cards.example_en: We spent the weekend at the beach.

back_cards.definition_en: To use up resources or energy
back_cards.example_en: He spent all his energy on the race.
They spent hours planning the event.
She spends a lot on charity donations.

back_cards.definition_en: A position or stage in a process
back_cards.example_en: She reached a new level in the game.

back_cards.definition_en: A degree of intensity or amount
back_cards.example_en: The noise level was too high.
The carpenter checked the level of the shelf.
He’s at the executive level in the company.

back_cards.definition_en: A measure of skill or ability
back_cards.example_en: This course is for advanced level students.

back_cards.definition_en: Having the skill to do something
back_cards.example_en: She’s able to solve complex math problems.
He was able to finish the project early.
They’re able to travel this summer.
I’m not able to drive without my glasses.
She’s able in both music and art.
The political debate was heated.
Her decision was political, not practical.
They discussed political reforms at the meeting.
The political rally drew a large crowd.
His comment was a political move to gain favor.
We’re almost at the train station.
He almost won the race but tripped.
The project is almost complete.

back_cards.definition_en: Very nearly in quantity or extent
back_cards.example_en: Almost everyone attended the meeting.
It’s almost time for lunch.
The boy played soccer in the park.
Her boy is starting school this year.

back_cards.definition_en: A term for a young man
back_cards.example_en: The delivery boy brought our pizza.
Come on, boys, let’s get moving!

back_cards.definition_en: A member of a group of youths
back_cards.example_en: The boys went camping by the lake.
She studies at a prestigious university.
The university published a new study.

back_cards.definition_en: A community of students and faculty
back_cards.example_en: The university hosts events for students.
He earned his degree from the university.
The university library is open late.
We arrived before the movie started.
She stood before the audience.
Check your work before submitting it.
He testified before the judge.
Her name comes before mine on the list.
